it.polimi.se2019.controller.actions.firemodes

Interface AddFireModeMethods

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AddActionMethods
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Action, CyberBlade_1, ElectroScythe_1, ElectroScythe_2, FireMode, FlameThrower_1, FlameThrower_2, Furnace_1, Furnace_2, Grab, GrabAdrenaline, GrabFrenzy, GrenadeLauncher_1, HeatSeeker_1, Hellion_1, Hellion_2, LockRifle_1, MachineGun_1, Move, MoveFrenzy, PlasmaGun_1, PowerGlove_1, PowerGlove_2, RailGun_1, RailGun_2, RocketLauncher_1, ShockWave_1, ShockWave_2, Shoot, ShootAdrenaline, ShootFrenzyGroup1, ShootFrenzyGroup2, ShotGun_1, ShotGun_2, SledgeHammer_1, SledgeHammer_2, Thor_1, TractorBeam_1, TractorBeam_2, VortexCannon_1, Whisper_1, ZX2_1, ZX2_2

    public interface AddFireModeMethods
    this methods must be implemented by both firemodes and actions to permit a correct communication
    Author:
    Galluccio

      • addCell

        void addCell(int x,
             int y)
      throws WrongInputException
        add a cell input
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate x of the cell
        y - coordinate y of the cell
        Throws:
        WrongInputException - if invalid input

              throws WrongInputException

      • addTargetingScope

        void addTargetingScope(int targetingCardID,
                       AmmoBag cost)
                throws WrongInputException,
                       NotPresentException,
                       NotEnoughAmmoException,
                       FiremodeOfOnlyMarksException
        add a Targeting Scope input
        Parameters:
        targetingCardID - the ID of the targeting scope
        cost - the AmmoBag the player wants to convert to damage
        Throws:
        WrongInputException - if invalid input
        NotPresentException - if card is not present
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the player doesn't have enough ammo
        FiremodeOfOnlyMarksException - if the firemode can't use targeting scopes because it only does marks to the targets

      • addOptional

        void addOptional(int numOptional)
          throws WrongInputException,
                 NotEnoughAmmoException
        add an optional Firemode input
        Parameters:
        numOptional - the number of the optional
        Throws:
        WrongInputException - if invalid input
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the player doesn't have enough ammo
